segment.source: Note In-app products cannot be offered from a trial version of an app.
segment.target: Note In-app products cannot be offered from a trial version of an app.

segment.source: Customers using a trial version of your app can only buy an in-app product if they purchase a full version of your app.
segment.target: Customers using a trial version of your app can only buy an in-app product if they purchase a full version of your app.

segment.source: Prerequisites

segment.source: A Windows app in which to add features for customers to buy.
segment.target: A Windows app in which to add features for customers to buy.

segment.source: When you code and test new in-app products for the first time, you must use the CurrentAppSimulator object instead of the CurrentApp object.
segment.target: When you code and test new in-app products for the first time, you must use the CurrentAppSimulator object instead of the CurrentApp object.

segment.source: This way you can verify your license logic using simulated calls to the license server instead of calling the live server.
segment.target: This way you can verify your license logic using simulated calls to the license server instead of calling the live server.

segment.source: To do this, you need to customize the file named "WindowsStoreProxy.xml" in %userprofile%\\AppData\\local\\packages\\package name\\LocalState\\Microsoft\\Windows Store\\ApiData.
segment.target: To do this, you need to customize the file named "WindowsStoreProxy.xml" in %userprofile%\\AppData\\local\\packages\\package name\\LocalState\\Microsoft\\Windows Store\\ApiData.

segment.source: The Microsoft Visual Studio simulator creates this file when you run your app for the first time—or you can also load a custom one at runtime.
segment.target: The Microsoft Visual Studio simulator creates this file when you run your app for the first time—or you can also load a custom one at runtime.

segment.source: Step 2: Add the in-app offers to your app
segment.target: Step 2: Add the in-app offers to your app

segment.source: For each feature that you want to make available through an in-app product, create an offer and add it to your app.
segment.target: For each feature that you want to make available through an in-app product, create an offer and add it to your app.

segment.source: Important You must add all the in-app products that you want to present to your customers to your app before you submit it to the Store.
segment.target: Important You must add all the in-app products that you want to present to your customers to your app before you submit it to the Store.

segment.source: If you want to add new in-app products later, you must update your app and re-submit a new version.

segment.source: Create an in-app offer token
segment.target: Create an in-app offer token

segment.source: You identify each in-app product in your app by a token.
segment.target: You identify each in-app product in your app by a token.

segment.source: This token is a string that you define and use in your app and in the Store to identify a specific in-app product.
segment.target: This token is a string that you define and use in your app and in the Store to identify a specific in-app product.

segment.source: Give it a unique (to your app) and meaningful name so that you can quickly identify the correct feature it represents while you are coding.
segment.target: Give it a unique (to your app) and meaningful name so that you can quickly identify the correct feature it represents while you are coding.
